review_title: WOW un voyage dans un autre monde

one_reviews_text: Build quality is very good. You can read everything online, why is this considered one of the best headset out there. Even better than the Rift S. Easy to set up and with some of Oculus' new changes, lower budget PC can run all games too. If you are into VR this is a must have.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on July 30, 2019

one_reviews_text: Una volta che si prova è difficile tornare indietro, se questo è il futuro non immagino tra qualche anno con i prossimi visori cosa si potrà avere tra le mani.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on March 28, 2019
review_title: Ottimo con un bel parco titoli alle spalle.

one_reviews_text: The rift was not originally planned for room scale tracking and it shows as needing the 3rd sensor for proper 360 room tracking.Distance and field of view and reach of the base stations are not the greatest.Expect to buy USB extension cables for stations when having medium place space.Screen door effect is noticeable but mostly ignored after you immerse yourself.The headset cable is not that short for a medium-sized area.The face pad it comes with is not the greatest.The touch controllers are amazing battery life is about a week so investing in rechargeable batteries is a must.Base stations definitely need some better mounts, but fortunately the use industry standard 1/4 threads so any cheap security camera mounts would do.Also had problems with people using it while wearing glasses so be aware.The god rays effect is also quite noticeable.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on December 6, 2018

one_reviews_text: Despues de probarlo, decidi adquirirlo, mi sorpresa fue que al abrirlo las pilas puestas, controles sucios, cables desacomodados, no venia con los juegos gratis, y un mes para que me regresen mi dinero, bastante molesto por esta experiencia.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on April 14, 2018
review_title: Producto usado, mala experiencia con amazon

one_reviews_text: After using multiple different VR systems currently out on the market, I personally chose the Rift over the others due to the feel of the headset on the face and I much prefer the controller style of the Rift over the Vive and others.It was quick and simple to set up, and works great for room scale. No issues with any games so far on either SteamVR or Oculus store.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on December 8, 2018
review_title: Great VR for a good price

one_reviews_text: Tout simplement parfait. Tout l'ensemble arrive sans aucun problème, tout fonctionne parfaitement et on peut rester facilement 2h sous le casque sans être mal.Attention quand même à avoir une bonne configuration, pour ma part un i7 4770 et une Geforce GTX 1060 (et tout roule)Prévoyez de la place derrière vous pour les capteurs.
review_date: Reviewed in France on February 22, 2018

one_reviews_text: Reçu dans un colis "protégé" et on ressent la souci de la livraison d'Amazon pour ce genre d'article (là où ils sont beaucoup moins regardant pour des éléments informatique aussi fragile mais bon...).C'est très agréable à utiliser, touch pads et capteur x2 présents, mais pas de quoi faire une immersion 360 (faut 2 autres capteurs).Des jeux offerts avec l'installation du casque, ils sont disponibles après quelques minutes dans votre bibliothèque.Un régal !
review_date: Reviewed in France on February 26, 2019

one_reviews_text: È un'ottimo VR divertentissimo ma se volete giocare bene vi serve uno spazio molto ampio e vi consiglio l'acquisto di un terzo sensore
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on July 6, 2019

one_reviews_text: Tenia miedo de adquirir mercancia por internet porque duadaba de su eficacia. Esta compra fue más un salto de fé que una decision meditada.La universidad requeria este equipo par una tarea y no podiamos hacer el viaje a USA para adquirirlo. Tambien creía que por internet te llegaria un producto reparado o re-acondicionado para la venta.Optamos por acudir a Amazon y nos costó casi  igual que en el sitio web del fabricante, no tuvimos que arriesgarnos en viajar a USA y gastar en gasolina, casetas de peaje ni tener cuestionamientos de agentes de aduana. LLego a micasa en pocos dias y siempre pude saber cuanto tiempo faltaba para la entrega. Recibimos un equipo nuevo de paquete y nos sorprendió la sencillesz y facilidad de la operacion.Ahora confio en las compras que hago en Amazon.
review_date: Reviewed in Mexico on May 26, 2018

one_reviews_text: Prodotto sicuramente fantastico ma da migliorare. La qualità video non è eccellente così come la messa a fuoco. Molto comodo e facile da usare.
review_date: Reviewed in Italy on October 18, 2019

one_reviews_text: Hatte das mit allen meinen Brillen, von den 4, die ich hatte. Nach einer Weile fällt der Ton aus und dann muss die Oculus Software neu gestartet werden.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on February 8, 2019
review_title: Schon wieder Ton der Kopfhörer nach 10 Min weg.

one_reviews_text: Necesario para mi, por lo menos, sudo mucho, y los audífonos que tiene originalmente absorben todo ese sudor, lo que complica compartir cuando no juego sólo yo.El audio es muy bueno, son muy cómodos, y se conectan muy fácil.

one_reviews_text: Après avoir tester l'HTC Vive qui est pourtant très bien mais j'ai préférer l'Oculus Rift, pourquoi ?Et bien pour plusieurs raisons:- Le coût, et oui, on ne va pas se mentir le coût de la technologie est très élevé même si elle a quand même diminué depuis quelques temps.- Le confort, j'ai largement préférer le confort du Rift à celui de l'Oculus, déjà il est plus léger et on ne le sens pas trop même après plusieurs longues heures de jeux.- L'ergonomie des manettes, les Touchs sont très jolies mais surtout très confortable et pratique à utilisé que celle de son homologue qui par ailleurs sont beaucoup moins esthétique.- La qualité d'affichage, sur le Rift j'ai moins vu l'effet de grille que sur le Vive de plus je trouve les couleurs plus vive et plus agréableSeul un petit défaut notable, il existe un léger jour entre le casque est le bas de notre nez mais il n'est pas visible une fois en jeuxPar contre niveau performance il vaut mieux avoir un très bon pc, GTX 960 recommandé au minimum, personnellement j'ai une GTX970 et un I7 4790K et tout va bien, couplé avec 8Go de RAM il arrive que certaine application comme Oculus Medium galère lors de grosse création mais sinon tout passe bien

one_reviews_text: The oculus rift is a winner, the experience is fantastic if you can get through the set up.A few pointers I'd make is:1. Be very careful with the lenses, they can become scratched by glasses, leaving marks that leave an irritating blur in the centre of vision.2. If you want to be able to turn 360 degrees and be able to face away from your computer, you need to set up a good sized space with either two cameras high in opposing corners (ensure they are facing towards the center) or purchase an additional sensor or two and place them facing inwards at equal distances around your play space.3. The controllers can sometimes become faulty and become loud and clicky due to the shifting of a rubber bumper in the trigger over time.Oculus support have been outstanding in my experience, simply make sure you have a good case for return, be polite and provide GOOD evidence.4. Sometimes the screens in units can be faulty, with unbalanced illumination in one screen over the other, this can cause a distracting effect in dark environments ingame, where it feels like one eye is blind.I have successfully applied for a replacement for this issue, but gathering evidence was difficult. If you encounter this issue and it bothers you enough to request replacement here is how I got my replacement: use the "big picture" oculus app, launch into the black environment and place something over the oculus proximity sensor, get a halfway decent camera (anything that can take long exposure photos) and take photos of the oculus lenses, this should show a difference in brightness, which is good evidence to use.Finally be aware about what cables you buy for use with the oculus and sensors, and make sure you have at least 3-4 USB 3.0 ports free and a decent computer before purchasing to avoid disappointment.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 29, 2018
review_title: Outstanding experience, decent product, but ensure you are prepared before buying.

one_reviews_text: Super teil macht was es soll einziger punkt im vergleich mit der playstation 4 VR Brille ist die verarbeitung etwas billig vor allem wenn mann sieht das das teil fast doppelt so viel kostet.ansonsten Super.

one_reviews_text: I want to preface this by saying I've used every form of modern VR. I've used the original DK1 Oculus. I bought the DK2. I own a Samsung Gear. All of these made for pretty decent VR experiences, but I could feel the future was definetely in this tech.Then came the CV1 of Oculus Rift - and it was great. Something was definetely missing though. Something HTC Vive later added with the full 360 degree freedom and touch controls.Now - here comes Oculus and completely blows the Vive out of the water with the Touch Controls.Here's reasons the Oculus Touch controllers are better than the HTC Vive controllers:[ * ] Controller: Smaller form factor makes for more ergonomic grip.[ * ] Controller: Better buttons & softer, more flexible triggers[ * ] Controller: Every button has touch function, adding yet another layer of depth to the controllers abilities.Here's reasons the Oculus Headset is better than the HTC Vive headset:[ * ] Headset: Much lighter - doesn't stress the neck as much as the Vive - I've played 5-6 hours without getting strained.[ * ] Headset: Less noticeable screen-door effect (and by extension, zero motion sickness)[ * ] Headset: Better straps that auto-adjust to your head, better lens distance controls[ * ] Headset: Built in microphone and earphones that make communication in multiplayer-games easier.[ * ] Headset: Less bulky cables - the whole headset connects through just one thin tube-cable as opposed to the Vive's flat 3-cable solution.Here's reasons the Oculus trackers are better than the HTC trackers:[ * ] Tracking stations: Better built with full-metal, weighted stands.[ * ] Tracking stations: Draws power from USB 3.0, doesn't require additonal power-supplies.[ * ] Tracking stations: More flexible in placements - doesn't really need their own tripods/mounts.You might ask, "okay, but what's the drawback?". You're right to ask!The major drawback of this bundle is that with only 2 tracker stations, you're limited to 180 or 270 degree tracking, depending on your setup. Beyond that your controllers might lose tracking briefly, and your headset can "jitter" a little bit when it loses the positional tracking. In order to get full 360 degree tracking, you should to buy an additional tracking station. It's possible to get 360 with just 2 trackers, but it's not as good. In my opinion though this isn't really a dealbreaker - especially not at this pricepoint. A lot of games offer a secondary form of turning (like using your joystick), which is honestly preferrably in a lot of cases to avoid tangling into the cable.So, overall, the Oculus Rift is a fantastic device and when it comes down to the headsets currently out on the market this is the most bang for your buck you're gonna get. Oculus slipped behind a little in the race when every other company started churning out their own headsets, so it's sad to see that they've caught such a bad rep in the VR world when they've honestly produced THE best headset on the market - it just took them a little more time to perfect it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 10, 2017
review_title: Worth every cent - vastly superior to the HTC Vive!

one_reviews_text: It's very good product, after 3 years it still works perfectly with a slightly lower resolution than its successor the Oculus Rift S but with better Black colors and obviously cheaper price. The competition is either much more expensive or cheap on the hardware and will deteriorate faster over time (htc vive). The only thing you really need with this is a tissue designed for the mask that will be in contact with the skin of your face whenj you put the mask on. so you can clean it when you sweat too much instead of letting the foam of the mask absorbing the sweat from your face, the tissue costs like 5 bucks and is good quality.

review_title: very good product with suprisingly long lasting hardware

one_reviews_text: I jumped at the opportunity to get this package at the bundle price, I can't wait because my eyesight seems to be failing.ON the positive: It is an amazing experience. It can really fool your brain, and put you into a different world. Elite dangerous, a space game, is particularly amazing.and the negative? Only if you wear glasses. It is scarcely possible to use this headset. I have tried many things, including making my own custom glasses to fit into the headset. But they simply don't work. I only use my contact lenses with the Oculus, glasses are simply not workable.You WILL scratch the internal lenses if you wear glasses, that is unavoidable.So that is it, brilliant, but with reservations. You can buy special lenses on the internet, I'm debating doing this since they are pretty expensive.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 20, 2017
review_title: Brilliant, so long as you don't wear glasses.

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Oculus Rift for Prepar3d and Elite Dangerous.The headset is well made and surprisingly comfortable. It worked first time out of the box except for issues with sound disengaging in game. This was fixed by turning off USB power save in windows 10.Setup is a little confusing but after an hour of trial and error everything works well. Sensor placement can be challenging if you have limited space but works flawlessly once setup correctly.You will need to invest in a good HOTAS joystick and throttle as you cannot use mouse with ED.The immersion with this headset is unreal. The view through the headset is a little pixelated and blurry at your peripheral vision but the immersion more than makes up for this. It does actually fool your brain into thinking you are inside a spaceship or aircraft. Try walking to the hatch in the rear of the Asp. I nearly fell down it!The only big issue is eye strain. An hour tops before your eyes are very tired.The built in ear phones are weak and do not fit my ears so I removed them with the supplied tool and use my own.The touch handsets are brilliant and work perfectly unfortunately ed doesn't work with them. They are still worth it.I give the rift 8 - 10. Better resolution and less blurries gets it a 10. However this is cutting edge so if you want vr this is it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 14, 2017
review_title: VR immersion the best you can get.

one_reviews_text: No instructions on how to install the setup.  Did not work at first.  Problems with usb not working and updated software not being recognized as updated.  Got stuck at the continue in headset part.  Was no stuff to look at except the background.  Uninstalled all the software.  R4einstalled the windows update parts and it worked.  As for the product when it is working.  The controllers could fit a bit more snug in hand.  Gets tiring having to grip them.  Lenses steam up a bit.  Turned on my cieling fan and it cured that.  As for the games and experience... IT IS AMAZING.  For the price now its definitely something you should buy if you got a decent PC.  As for the wires I have installed 3 bungee cords on ceiling.  There are alternative ceiling mounts and wire booms.  I chose this method and it only cost me £7 This is important as 3 times we stood on the wires and nearly ripped pc of the table.  Until you tried this on and had a go its impossible to be described how it feels.  I have felt sick, dizzy, screaming in fear. In fact it brings out emotions i thought had gone forever.  Watching Amazon Videos with it is great too.  Even find myself putting my feet up on the virtual cinema seats and wondering where my legs have gone.  There are many types of VR experiences and one will suit you.  Project Cars is so realistic.  All thats missing is the G forces and wind.  If you ok with messing about for an hour or so to get it set up then grab it at this silly price.Yopu can use steam with it too and many other software companies.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 19, 2017
review_title: Very well made and good price at £349 will put a whole new life into you PC

one_reviews_text: Comfortable and does everything it advertises.
review_date: Reviewed in Australia on February 8, 2019

one_reviews_text: After having the PSVR on PS4Pro and playing most of what was on offer it was good but just didnt have that 'wow' factor for me, So I took the risk and purchased the Oculus Rift Touch bundle while on offer @£399 and hoped it was better in some way and to cut a long story short im glad I did the feel, Graphics, Resolution, Polish and overall experience is almost night & day difference for the better and the controllers are amazingly accurate. So if your wondering if its worth it or your on the fence I would say go for it 100% but I'd like to share a few tips before you buy that may help..1) Go to the oculus website and download the compatibility check program, It will tell you if anythings lacking from your system before buying.2) Unless you have 3 Free USB 3.0 slots at the back of your computer and even then it's picky if you do, your going to need a USB 3.0 PCI Card as extra I went for the Inateck 5 Port model which works fine.3) The Headset plugs into a HDMI slot on the back of your graphics card which my single slot was already taken by my 4ktv/Monitor and the only free slots I had was Display Port only, You cannot simply hot swap between the two devices because you need to see whats happening on the montior so I solved this problem by buying the 'CSL - 4K Ultra HD Displayport to HDMI adapter with audio transmission' Priced at £8.99 from Amazon which again works perfect.4) There is virtually no instructions in the box and until you goto the oculus website and download the app your flying blind, so dont be hasty and start plugging things in until you have installed the Oculus Home App which takes you through the whole process step by step.The setup process is a bit of a pain and took several tries with setting up the much smaller than expected sensors and play area, But after that's done your good to go and enjoy the tons of content on the oculus & steam store.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 1, 2017
review_title: This is the Premium VR Kit your looking for :)

one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing vr experience until today I'd only tried psvr and today after a easy and simple set up my mind was blown by the Oculus. The free games are great especially Robo recall and I also bought Superhot Vr and it was mind blowingly cool it makes you feel like you're in the matria.  If you want a vr for a great price and trust me I think all £405.99 Inc postage was worth every single penny not a single regret. The headset is very light compared to the psvr and the touch controllers feel so natural and when handling guns in game the touch controllers feel like you're holding a weapon. Trust me buy one if you can you won't regret it ; )

one_reviews_text: I bought this after owning the Google daydream headset, the daydream was good, but it lacked the immersion required to make you feel you were somewhere else. The Rift is a hugely different experience, deliving an interactive world that you can move around in. In the demo I was blown away by being able to crouch down and look under the desk. When I tried to pull on the virtual desk to stand up I fell on my real face. My brain was tricked! Google Earth VR is one of the most amazing  experiences I've had. Honestly no idea how they have mapped a 3D world.Set up was fine, although I was hampered by one of the earphones not working. I spent a good few hours messing around with drivers, only to find that the earphone is connected with a screw and contacts, tightening the screw fixed the issue for me.You need 3 free USB ports for the sensors and headsets. I'm using 3 USB 3.0 ports, but I think it allows you to plug one of the sensors into a USB 2.0The guardian system allows you to map out a virtual playspace in the real world, so if you are approaching a wall or furniture in the real world the system throws up a virtual blue Grid to show you the limits.I've set a play space up in the front room, spacing the sensors fairly wide gives you almost 360 degrees, a 3rd sensor will give you full 360.I bought the bundle for 399 during the summer sale, at this price with everything included it's a bargain.You can also set it up to work with Steam VR for even more experiences.Highly Recommended
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 12, 2017

one_reviews_text: Gaming will never be the same.  Where to start?  From the moment you start installing this I could feel the excitement building and I was not disappointed.  The setup was seriously simple and I lost count of the times I said WOW.  But this is VR for the first time for me so I guess that's to be expected.This device is easy to setup, not as uncomfortable as it looks and the controllers are great.  Be sure to spend some time adjusting the straps and not have it too tight as this did give me a headache to start with - and this device makes it easy to adjust.My one criticism is about the cable attached to the side (USB and HDMI) to the PC.  Some games that require you to spin around can be tedious because the cable gets tied up in your chair. Even in a cockpit style game I find the cable draped over my shoulder to be annoying so I've stuck a plastic cable holder to the back of my chair to keep the cable behind me.Overall I love this device and look forward to seeing more choice of games and apps.

one_reviews_text: I bought this during the Oculus summer sale at £399 and found it very easy to setup and have working. I also purchased and Anker 4 port USB 3.0 hub, that I use for the two sensors and both show as connected via USB 3.0 within the Oculus set up software. I plugged the headset into an HDMI on my graphics card, with my monitor attached to a Display port as well as to it's own USB 3.0 direct on my PC motherboard.I also own the PlayStation PSVR and can confirm little difference in the quality of the display during use. I do like the PSVR nose cover as the Oculus leaves this more open and you can see through the gap around the bridge of your nose. This was however, less of a problem when playing a game as I was very immersed and did not notice the gap. It is great that the Oculus comes with attached speakers where you really need additional headphones with the PSVR. The speakers are loud and give good detail and kept me in the vr experiences I have tried.My other main difference is that the PSVR seems mainly designed around a seated experience except when using the aim controller, but again this is a more static experience from all the games and experiences I have used on my PSVR and play pro. The Oculus, now coming with the touch controllers has opened up into more of a room scale and during setup, you mark the edge of your room to allow it to tell you when you are reaching past your borders and about to hit the wall!My problem with this is that I do not have a large room, where my PC is stored. It is about 6 foot by 11 foot but with my computer and desk there is little movement room left and the sensor view to reach the floor is limited by my desk. There had been no recommendation for room size and this is why I have dropped a star! It seems from running set up for SteamVR for room scale, my play space is not big enough and within Oculus it is not the best. I have noted that the PC versions of games and experiences use moor movement and allow you to pick items from the floor. This has occasionally been difficult for me to do as they have been laying in VR space, just beyond my physical space, so I have had the warning  to let me know I am reaching a wall.This has been a slight loss in my experience and it seems that each game is different. However, as a general rule, the PC version of VR seem to give more freedom of movement whereas the PSVR limits this but makes it a better headset for limited space.Now the touch controllers are fantastic and very easy to use. I love the fact that the top edges and triggers are touch sensitive and know when your fingers are off them allowing you to raise a thumb or point a finger or make a closed fist. They are very responsive and track very well, even when I have completely turned around, which I find I am able to do far more with Oculus. I often forget which way I am facing and yet the tracking still seems to work well.Now, the comfort of the headset... I wondered if the strap was going to be too tight and give me a VR mark around my face, but no problems as long as you don't over tighten the straps. I actually found that having loooser straps made the fit more comfortable and stilll held the headset in place. It is also lighter than the PSVR headset which has a band that tightens onto your head and then the headset slides up to your face. So different approaches but both seem to work well.Finally, when your headset is not in use, put it back in the sturdy box that the headset arrived in. I keep mine plugged into the PC and put the headset and extra cable into the box, close the lid with the cable out of the side and lay it alongside my PC. This will keep the dust from my VR headset and protect it from unwanted knocks or bangs.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 18, 2017
review_title: Great VR headset and now cheapest VR if you already own a recent gaming PC, but better in a bigger room!

one_reviews_text: An sich ist das Gerät genial, ich habe richtig meinen Spass damit, jedoch muss hier Oculus einiges nachbessern, aber eher beim Qualitätscheck und dem Support als wirklich bei der Technik....Erste Brille kam mit einem "Klebefleck" hinter der linse auf der Linken seite, funktionierte zwar trotzdem, jedoch für das Geld nicht einzusehen. Also Nachbestellung angefordert.Nachbestellung angekommen, hier nun auch auf BEIDEN seiten Klebereste hinter der linse, auch wenn diese nicht so Stark waren. (Oder Beschädigung, keine Ahnung, zumindest auch nicht hinnehmbar)Jedoch nun zum (meiner Meinung nach) krassen an der Sache...Beim Direkt-Vergleich zwischen beiden Brillen war bei der ersten eine gewisse Farbunechtheit festzustellen, außerdem war das Tracking schlechter als bei der Nachlieferung, wie kann sowas bitte vorkommen?! Wären die Linsen okay gewesen und ohne direkten vergleich hätte ich es nie gemerkt, das ist aber einfach ein no-go weil bei sowas motion-sickness vorprogrammiert ist!Also mit Amazon und Oculus geschrieben, Amazon klasse reagiert, haben wohl ihr Lager überprüft, nach 2 Wochen nochmal nachgefragt und anscheinend gabs da wirklich eine schlechte Charge... weitere Packung geschickt bekommen und diese ist nun Perfekt ohne jegliche Beanstandung!Zum Oculus Support:Ich wollte zumindest ein Feedback abgeben, und trotz genauer Beschreibung und Bilder etc. habe ich erstmal eine Standard Mail bekommen das es der normale Verwischeffekt wäre, dann nach kurzem hin und her und Erklärung habe ich ein Video geschickt um zu verdeutlichen das es das definitiv nicht ist. Dann kam ein Software-Troubleshooting Guide wegen des Farbeffekts, was soll ich damit wenn's definitiv ein Hardware Defekt ist? Habe also freundlich zurückgeschrieben das ich bei der ersten Brille definitiv kein Softwaretroubleshooting durchführen werde wegen der Farb-Unechtheit, vor allem da ja im direkten Vergleich ohne Reboot etc. die neuere Brille genauso lief nur eben besser, sowie das ich das restliche mit dem Händler kläre. Danach kam dann eine Mail das man Verständnis dafür hätte und ich bitte noch einen Auszug aus meinem Kompatibilitätstool schicken soll. Warum denn? Reine Datensammlerei? Was hilfts bei einem eindeutigen Produktionsmangel?Ich behalte diese Brille da ich keine Lust habe 2 Jahre auf bessere Technik zu warten und diese einfach die beste vom P/L verhältnis ist, denn dafür ist sie wirklich klasse und macht wie gesagt einen Heiden Spaß auch wenn der Weg dafür jetzt lange war bis zum besten Erlebnis. Die Software benötigt auch noch einige Verbesserungen, aber ich denke das wird noch kommen.Also, Augen auf beim Oculus Kauf ;-)Edit: Habe noch ein paar Fotos angefügt das ihr seht worauf zu achten ist, das Bild ohne die roten Kreise bzw markierungen ist das wo man die makellose Linse sieht wie sie sein sollte.

one_reviews_text: I recommend that you check the Oculus rift compatibility tool before purchasing as unfortunately it's incompatible with many common usb 3.0 controllers. Here's some of the following incompatible ones:Etron USB 3.0 Extensible Host ControllerVIA USB 3.0 eXtensible Host Controller - 1.0 (Microsoft)ASMedia USB 3.0 eXtensible Host ControllerASMedia XHCI ControllerRenesas USB 3.0 eXtensible-HostcontrollerUnfortunately my usb controllers are Etron and as a result i'm having difficulty with my setup, i'm determined to make this work however and have purchased a USB 3.0 PCIE expansion: https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00B6ZCNGM/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1i'm short on space however and don't know if I'll be able to make this work as I'll also need a PCIE 1x extension as it's buried under my graphics card, failing that 'll upgrade my motherboard to experience the awesomeness of the rift.Long story short, save yourself a headache and check the compatibility tool first.Edit: The headset works on my current USB 3.0 ports while the sensors throw back errors and point blank refuse, I've had to connext these to USB 2.0 ports until I upgrade my motherboard.While this is working well even with the sensors on usb 2.0 I feel the experience would undoubtedly be smoother on usb 3.0 and I look forward to testing the difference. Will update this review once new motherboard installed.Update:My new motherboard and usb 3.0 pcie card has been installed and the Oculus Rift is running like a dream, absolutely brilliant experience. The lenses on the headset and my own glasses do tend to fog up a bit during play which can be irritating but you can take care of this with any number of anti-fog solutions. Personally I'm using Cat Crap.I've upgraded my initial review from 3 stars to 4 stars. While the Oculus is amazingly fun the fogging on the lenses and incompatibility with some of the most common USB 3.0 controllers around means it's a step away from being a perfect 5 stars. I suspect that in future the oculus will go through software revisions and design revisions to alleviate these issues.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 18, 2017
review_title: Check the Oculus rift compatibility tool before purchasing!

one_reviews_text: I have never used a vr headset before and was not sure if itvwoukd be any good. I went by the reviews which are mostly positive. Got to say, I was gobsmacked when I tried this for the first time . The word immersive does not do it justice. It is like being teleported into the game. I have a mid spec gaming pc, core i5 with a 1060 graphics card and all games are very smooth. The rift comes in premium packaging and is lightweight on the face. The controllers are amazing and gives a very natural interaction with the game environment. The first game I tried was no limits roller coaster, incredibly realistic although don't try it on a full stomach. Vol flight sim was just like being in a plane cockpit. Lots of the shorter experience type games are free. Agree with many reviewers that the headphones are great quality. However, having only games in hd I was also impressed with image quality which looks as good as  hd to me. I tgink this is the most amazing piece of tech I have ever tried, and will only grow better as more titles are released. Simply awesome!

one_reviews_text: Started with the Oculus DK2 ,two reasons ,1st to see if i would get dizzy or feel sick using it and second save money if i did .While the DK2 is an utter mind blowing experience, the consumer oculus rift CV1 with touch is mind blowing +++ .The optics are far better albeit slight distortion from the revamped fresnal lens which causes slight flare from white on black background .The touch brings your hands into the game ,a real must for games .It is a lighter weight than the DK2 and much more comfy on the head ,the earphones work fine and sound great .If you want to get into VR and not sure about the price/feeling sick ,get a DK2 for a few weeks and see what happens before the big buy on this but all i can say is "Fantastic product and utter out of this world" .Just to let you know ,im 52 years old and love this.

one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing product. I bought the playstation VR when it was released. The lack of games and their prices made me buy Oculus when it became cheaper. I can not be happier, it was the right decision. Compared to this one, PSVR is just a toy.If you like flight simulators then you will need one of this. You feel literally like you are inside the cockpit. Actually you will feel teleported to another world.The setup is fairly easy, but I would recommend this to people who have at least a basic knowledge in computing and only to people who like gaming. Most of the negative reviews I saw are because of the lack of knowledge of the users. I didn't have any problems with the setup or the hardware itself, but If you do, just try to google for an answer.

one_reviews_text: To start with, my overall opinion is very positive, in fact its better than i thought it would be, games like robot recall are stupidly impressive and immersive.Pros:Very responsive tracking, the fact you can wander around a virtual environment on foot is just awsome as is the ability to duck and dodge.Hardly any screendooring.The hand controllers are really well done, using them becomes second nature very quickly.The gfx in most games are extrordinary good, your senses are fooled by the immersion. Try the app where you fall off a skyscraper, i guarentee you will get a sinking feeling then flinch as you hit the ground.The headset itself is very comfortable to wear and easy to adjust.Sound quality through the earpieces is suprisingly good (although see below).Cons:On my unit the sound cuts out on the left headphone every now and then, flicking it a few times fixes it. Dont know if its a sensor issue or my unit has a loose wire but its not serious enough to send it back.Although the setup app is really well done, there could be more detailed instructions in the box to get you started, theres liturally 1 note saying go to this website and nothing else.So overall, i love this product and look forward to whatever vr developments lie ahead.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 20, 2017

one_reviews_text: I was there is the 70's when Space Invaders hit the local chippy. I was there when Dragon' lair appeared in 83 in the arcades. I've owned every games console and computer since the VCS. There have been some fantastic breakthroughs across the years and this is one of those moments. Trying Occulus vr for the first time is simply breathtaking. The fluidity of movement and most of all the ability to hold your hands out and pick thems up and manipulate them in the virtual world is something that even after owning this thing for 6 weeks or so still amazes me.Like any new technology there are a few issues that i have with the device. The main one is that I can only play in 20 minute sessions as it can make you feel a bit ill in some experiences. I feel that the second issue of the user getting quite hot when wearing the headset contributes to this but i suspect having a fan in front of you when playing would help considerably. I should say that i only really experience motion sickness in games where you are floating and have no fixed position to relate to such as a car dashboard. In driving games i can play for much longer (1hr +).A great bit of kit.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 17, 2017

Which was an experience in itself as the guy was moving his arms and hands as some people do when they talk and this was shown in-game with his character thanks to the excellent motion tracking of the controllers.If you've clicked reviews to see what people are saying...then you're already interested enough to buy one! You need no more justification trust me! It's worth every penny!I'm currently playing this on a gtx780 graphics card which is a good 4-5 years and it still runs very smoothly on this!  Which surprised me but nice to see.

one_reviews_text: Bought the bundle on sale for £349. Worked flawlessly first time after setup.Here's the lowdown: Running a fully updated Windows 10 x64 with the Fall Creator's Update, the latest 388.71 drivers for the Nvidia 980ti, the latest bios and drivers for the motherboard, Asus Z170 Pro Gaming, also the latest firmware and drivers for the 3rd party onboard USB 3.0 controller from Asmedia.First I made an account on the Oculus site, then downloaded and installed the Oculus Home software, turned off the PC, connected the sensors to the Intel USB 3.0 ports, there are four in a row so I used the left most port for one sensor and the right most port for the second, this is apparently the best way to connect them, since it puts them on separate controllers. Then I connected the headset lead to the HDMI port on the 980ti and the headsets USB lead to the Asmedia USB 3.0 port, again to make sure in was on a different controller. This apparently ensures that any one controller doesn't get flooded and overrun with data.Turned the PC back on and waited for a minute or two for Windows to finish doing it's thing of detecting the new hardware in the background, then ran Oculus Home software, the software ran and recognised I'd connected the hardware and started going through the set procedure, I'd placed the sensors to my front left and rear right facing each other diagonally about ten feet apart as suggested for the experimental 360 setup, everything went smoothly and setup was done in about 5 mins and then I was in and playing the First Contact tutorial demo. No issues.I'm very impressed overall with The Rift, the tracking works very well when setup right and games looks much better than I was expecting, the sense of depth and immersion is really quite incredible. There are one or two annoyances, the God Rays, this is when you have something bright in the foreground against a darker background, you get streaks of light coming from the brighter object, which can be distracting but overall it doesn't happen often and you start to eventually tune it out anyway unless it's really bad. 2nd the headset can be a bit of a pain to get just right, if the straps and lens spacing aren't absolutely spot on then the image will be blurry, the difference between sharp and blurry can be just a matter of a couple of millimeters, this is especially true for the position of the headset on your face with regards to how high or low you have it. Getting it just right also helps alleviate the god ray effect. It's also tempting to put it on really tight, but I find if it's too tight and close to your face, it's becomes uncomfortable fast and makes the god rays worse, there appears to be an optimal distance that makes the god ray problem a minimal annoyance.In summary, an awesome experience so far and worth every penny.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 3, 2018

one_reviews_text: Ich habe seit der Veröffentlichung der Rift mit einem Kauf geliebäugelt aber die Sache war mir einfach zu teuer. Den entsprechenden PC hatte ich war aber einfach nicht bereit über 600€ für diese Brille auszugeben wo man doch ab und an wieder von Dingen wie Fliegengittereffekt, eingeschränktes Sichtfeld usw. las.Jetzt kurz vor Weihnachten waren ja alle diese Preissenkungen und dann war da im Amazon Warehouse eine Rift inkl. Touch Controller für 355€ und da konnte ich nicht mehr anders als zuzuschlagen.Das Gerät kam hier im ungeöffneten Original Karton an, alle Klebebänder und Linsenschutz-Aufkleber waren noch drauf, also gehe ich davon aus eine nagelneue Rift bekommen zu haben. Allerdings ist der rechte Köpfhörer "defekt" bzw. hat einen Wackelkontakt, was lt. Internet-Foren eine Art Serienfehler ist und von Oculus problemlos als Tauschgrund anerkannt wird. Wenn man weiß wie man damit umgehen muss funktioniert es ohne Probleme und ist im Moment kein Grund für mich die Brille zum Tausch einzuschicken, habe ja noch einige Zeit Garantie drauf.Der erste Eindruck und das erste Erlebnis mit der Brille war: WOW !!!  Der "First Contact" der Touch Controller - also das Minispiel mit dem Roboter auf dem Holodeck ... wie geil ist das denn? Der Hammer! Die Immersion ist so dermaßen gut gelungen, man fühlt sich wirklich mittendrin. Auch Robo Recal usw. echt klasse und jeden Cent wert!Klar, wenn man sich mal die Zeit nimmt und alles ganz genau anschaut sieht man das Fliegengitter, auch der "Blick durch die Taucherbrille" fällt auf - aber hey, das ist alles nichts gegen dieses hineinziehen in die Spielewelt.Egal ob es der Rennwagen in Project Cars, RaceRoom oder Assetto Corsa ist - dieses mitten drin sein ist Weltklasse! Hier merkt man dann auch ob der PC "nur" den Anforderungen der Rift entspricht oder ob man noch ein bisschen Reserven an Leistung hat. Project Cars 2 braucht schon richtig Rechenpower von CPU und GPU.Wie geschrieben, ich habe den Kauf absolut  nicht bereut und würde es jeder Zeit wieder tun! Wie geil wird das erst wenn die nächste Generation von VR Brillen kommt... ich kann's kaum abwarten, aber bis dahin spiele ich noch gerne ein paar Runden in PC2 ;-)Viele GrüßeHolger
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on December 25, 2017
review_title: ...habe lange mit mir gekämpft - aber es nicht wirklich bereut!

one_reviews_text: Fantastic peice of kit that transforms your room into another living breathing world. The sensors pick up just about every bit of movement which was the part I was sceptical about you aim a gun and it hits where you aim simple !!!The other part of the headset and experience comes from the amazing headphones I personally can't believe how good they are. I've played a couple of games which were Apollo 11 and Arktika.1One was the amazing Apollo moon landing that puts you right in the centre of it all which is a fantastic experience and Arktika.1 is (almost) my perfect game , the games shooting mechanics are what I've always wanted to experience in a game, and i cannot imagine  that they have actually nailed this it's literally like being in an actual shoot out, hiding behind cover with decent AI flanking you then popping out shooting back is amazing, the guns and environments are also brilliant i can't recommend this game enough.I bought an Xbox one x 2 weeks ago and after buying the Oculus Rift Ive not used the Xbox one X since!!!One piece of advice is if to are skeptical go and try one if yo can and have a go on one but I assure you that to will wish you had bought a Rift ages ago.I can't wait for what the future holds for VR and I am IN for the long haul.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 2, 2017
review_title: The Experience i have always wanted.

one_reviews_text: Was a little sceptical initially as thought it might be a fad thing, but after seeing plenty of reviews and the Rift dropping in price a lot I thought I'd treat myself for xmas, so glad I did.Just like all the reviews said, without playing it yourself its hard to explain just how good it is.Its a crazy experience, some of the games Ive really enjoyed are Google earth VR (which is free aswell) Epic Rollercoasters (although after a while I feel a bit quessy due to the fast motion), Luckys Tale (Free with the rift), Cmoar Cinema (its like sitting in a cinema watching your movies, amazing), Pinball FX2 VR and Retro Neon Arcade.I bought some cheap USB and HDMI extenders so im not limited in movement and also a 3.0 usb hub aswell, I also intend on buying another sensor for behind me aswell, but thats not a must buy right now.I did have a slight issue getting the sensors set up, but that was due to my small playing space, which I do intend to sort out soon but as for now its all set up and can happily play in the small space I have.Would I recommend the rift? Most definitely and I can only see more development from software companies in the future, so if you were like me and just trying to decide I'd say take the plunge you'll love it!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2017
review_title: Amazing Experience, A Must Have For Sure!!

one_reviews_text: Absolutely blown away with this product. Very easy to set up and get going. Also pleasantly surprised by the lack of cable mess. The touch controllers are also amazing.My only negative that's stops it being 5 stars would be that I can see some like coming in from the bottom of the head set where the space is for my nose. Also it can be hard to focus as you can only change the lens spacing. You also have to move the head set up and down on your head to adjust but this is all part of the setup.I felt a bit of buyers guilt after spending £400 on this but can honestly say 10 minutes into playing this that was totally gone.

one_reviews_text: Since the price came down to ~£400, this is now actually a worthy alternative to the Vive. While the Vive is still better, this offers pretty much the same experience, just on a budget. The tracking can be a little iffy at times, and I only have a small playspace so I'm not one to comment on how good the room-scale is, but overall it works great and offers exactly what I wanted from VR. To be honest I prefer the Touch controllers over the Vive ones, too.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 20, 2018

one_reviews_text: Yes I love it but, it was a bit a an Ass to set up.  I got there in the end but only after starting again after digesting a lot of advice from various forums.  In reality, the set up is simple, when it works first time, and I think for most people it does.For anyone reading this, make sure your graphics drivers are up to date.  Install a copy of the Oculus tool tray which is a free app that gives you a few extra settings to play with  Check your anti virus hasn't decided it does not like it. Don't put your headset usb into a powered port and if it does not work correctly first time, just calmly start again :)One more thing ...if you are trying to play games purchased from steam, remember to click the option in settings that allows you to play software oculus does not "approve of"- amused me a lot that one.When it finally works perfectly its very worth it..
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 13, 2017
review_title: Wonderful - once its little bugs were fixed

one_reviews_text: Just thought id share my initial impression of the rift as it only arrived yesterday. I also own PSVR and to be honest despite having that VR wow factor there are too many things wrong about it for me to have an enjoyable experience so its basically been gathering dust for the last couple of months. Oculus is a whole new ball game.Initial impressions are good, upon opening the box it just has a premium feel. and its very easy to put everything back in for portability. So I went about setting the machine up with my I7 1060 laptop. And it couldn't be easier, just go to website and follow a very easy tutorial and a few minutes later your good to go.All I can say is for me this leaves PSVR in the dust. Everything is just right!Headset is very comfortable and easy to set, One of the biggest problems I had with PSVR was light leaking in where my nose was and id literally have to jam my face as far into the headset as possible to get darkness and the sweet spot for clarity. None of this with the rift, it just fits perfectly so no light and sweet spot is very easy to achieve.Resolution is great and isn't as misty as PSVR but be aware at the current time none of the headsets have super pin sharp visuals, but at the moment this is as good as it gets and after a wee while you no longer notice.Tracking is superb, another issue I had with PSVR was that the tracking would drift. this would completely destroy immersion as I had to correct the controller position which would start to rotate to the left. Oculus is just spot on, its like having a second pair of hands.Lastly id like to mention how good the headphones and sound are, its so much better having them on the side of the headset, psvr makes you attach yet another wire to the mess of wires you already have and means your constantly untangling wires.And this is the crux of the matter, PSVR compromises trying to squeeze VR into existing peripherals. The Oculus is designed for VR and the touch controllers are a game changer It really is like having real hands.So bottom line is if you have a powerful enough pc don't hesitate just grab this as at this price its about the same as a PSVR and your getting a much better experience. And you`ll never forget the first time you open your eyes in a vr world and realise this is the future of gaming.VR will improve with things like eye tracking, higher screen resolution and wireless connections in the future but that's at least a couple of years away. So jump on in :)
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 9, 2017

one_reviews_text: Can't describe how good this is.The little picky things people complain about. Like the screen door effect and the god rays, are just picky. Get in a game and you don't notice. It's like looking for a particular detail on a painting. It doesn't matter compared to the bigger picture.Comfort is good very adjustable straps fits perfectlyTracking is very good. Can only compare this to PSVR and not a HTC vive, however this doesn't lose tracking. Unless you turn your back to the sensors and they can no longer see your motion controls. Headset has a tracking triangle on the back so stays tracked.The controllers themselves. Are fantastic. Very very comfortable buttons are all in the right places, easily found and work flawlessly.The price.. worth every penny!If you have the PC and your considering buying one. Just get it. You won't be disappointed!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2017

one_reviews_text: So I took the plunge and purchased this bundle during the £399 summer sale and I have to say I am really pleased with my purchase and the massive discount. At full price (£499) it is still worth the cost though.If you are an advid PC gamer like me you will really enjoy getting into VR. It's unlike any other innovation in PC gaming. Offering a whole new experience.I was worried that the lower resolution would bother me as I had tried the PSVR before which has no comparison to RIFT really. The image quality is significantly better on the RIFT and can even be improved with super sampling if your rig can handle it.I would advise picking up some wall brackets/clips to get the sensors up high, they work much better when totally stable and you wont have to run the sensor setup everytime you nudge a sensor on your desk.If you like me you have a limited play area and 360° gaming is not really an option, there are still plenty of games to play so don't worry about that.Currently there are not enough substantial games for the RIFT but it's getting better and there are some definite must buys out there now.Highly recommended. The next RIFT/VIVE is likely 2+ years away so don't wait on them, just go for it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 14, 2017

one_reviews_text: I’ve had this now for a couple of months. I run it on a very good PC (1000W psu, core i7, 16 Gb DDR4 3000 RAM, GTX1080 Ti graphics card). The VR experience is just awesome - even once the initial ‘wow’ factor subsides it is incredible fun. I play some games in VR and others is normal desktop mode. The bundled game - robo recall is very well designed and huge fun. Elite Dangerous Horizons is great fun in VR too. If you have a PC that’s up to the job I would thoroughly recommend the rift.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 21, 2017

one_reviews_text: Having spent around six months contemplating the pros and cons of delving into VR, I finally took the plunge with the Oculus Rift. I spent time reading lots of articles comparing it to the HTC Vive and other VR devices, and watching YouTube videos of owner reviews. Having experienced it for myself now, one question comes to mind: Why didn't I get it sooner?!Let's face it, there are only REALLY two main competitors out there when it comes to experiencing VR on your home PC. Oculus or HTC. And the one thing i've learned during my six months of contemplation is that there are a lot of people who believe that one is "better" than the other. much like the age-old Android/Apple smartphone debate.Ultimately, the specs between the Oculus and the HTC are very much the same, but each device has it's own merits and demerits, as does everything these days.So, why did I go for the Rift? Well, a BIG deciding factor was the price difference between it and the Vive. Aside from the additional tracking sensors and a camera for the chaperone system on the Vive, I really didn't see how it could possibly cost £200 more than the Rift. The additional sensors apparently make for a much better room-scale VR experience, but since I live in a tiny studio flat and only intend to use VR for standing or seated experiences, the Rift is better geared for that out-of-the-box, whereas the Vive would have been overkill for my personal needs, requirements and limitations. Also, the Oculus Touch bundle seemed to offer excellent value for money since the headset package alone costs £80 more. Crazy!Regarding the controllers, it seems that the reviews I had read and watched favoured the Oculus Touch controllers over the Vive controllers, and understandably so. The Touch controllers are smaller and are a comfortable fit in the hand. The buttons, triggers and thumbsticks are naturally placed, and I love how the controller knows what position your fingers and thumbs are in, even if they're not touching any buttons. Each controller takes one AA battery (pack of 2 included in box), and it will last for around 30 hours of gameplay. That's a LOT of gameplay, with experienced owners saying they are replacing controller batteries every 2-3 months.Setup seems fairly straightforward, as long as you have a minimum of 3x3 feet of play area, so the sensors can do their job effectively. Incidentally, I read many reports of people having tracking issues with the Rift. I've not experienced any tracking issues at all so far, and it's had a lot of use over the last couple of weeks. The sensors have also been relocated twice while I was rearranging furniture and making more room, and still i've had no problems. (If, during the setup stage, the software tells you to continue setup in your headset, and you find the setup video continually looping the last few seconds, just restart your computer to solve this issue.)So onto the headset itself. I love the design. Its somewhat smaller and less ugly than the Vive. It's also reportedly lighter, making it more comfortable to wear for long periods. The adjustable straps are durable and comfortable, and the built-in headphones are unbelievably good for their size, and have such good clarity and wide frequency response, with crisp, clear highs and prominent lows. I was expecting to remove them on the first day so i could use my own headphones, but I haven't used any other headphones as yet. They really are that good!The display quality is as to be expected for current VR devices. VR is still in it's infancy, so it will likely still be a couple of years yet before we can expect to see HD resolution in these tiny displays. That said, what i've experienced so far is still nothing short of absolutely mind blowing! Yes you can see individual pixels, but only really if you're thinking about them. Once you're drawn into a VR video or game, you won't be thinking about it. You'll be lost in the immersion of 360 sights and surround sound. I'm using my unit a lot on flight sims, and while cockpit/instrument text can appear grainy, the overall immersive quality is breathtaking, giving you a real sense of height, speed and distance. I've heard that the Vive has a brighter display, but I do wonder HOW much brighter, since I personally wouldn't want the Rift display to be any brighter than it already is. To me, that would be uncomfortable and headache-inducing. Speaking of which, I haven't yet experienced headaches, sickness or dizziness as a result of VR alone. I did initially experience slight nausea the first time I went into a flight sim in VR, but that's something i've gotten used to. Everyone will have their own tolerances and sensitivities, so I would recommend trying out VR first if you've never experienced it, so you can gain some idea of how it might affect you, as well as what it can offer in terms of enjoyment. Lastly, i've heard people complaining about the heat from the headset. At this point i'm lost, because I haven't felt any real heat from the unit. It gets a little warm, but only a bit. It's barely noticeable.I don't know what the microphone quality is like as I haven't used it yet, but the sheer fact that a built-in mic, headphones AND the display itself all runs through a single trailing cable as opposed to the multiple cables on the Vive was another deciding factor for me.The trailing cable from the headset is around 12 feet long, and while it's not really suitable for room scale VR gaming, I am led to believe you can use extension cables up to 16 feet to allow extra freedom of movement. You may want to clarify this prior to purchase, if cable length is a concern to you. The cable terminates into two "tails". One for HDMI connection (which needs to be connected to your graphics card HDMI socket, NOT the motherboard HDMI socket), and a USB 3.0 connection.Both sensors also have USB 3.0 connectivity. Oculus say that both should be connected to USB 3.0 sockets, but subsequent sensors can be connected via USB 2.0. I have one sensor connected to USB 3.0, and the other connected to USB 2.0, and they are both working fine. The setup software even acknowledges and accepts these connections.Finally, there are many places advertising spare parts and accessories for the Rift. It seems most of these items are not readily available through online retailers though, at least not here in the UK. Personally, i'm not worried about that, but if it's readily available parts and accessories you're after, you might want to consider the Vive.I definitely feel I made the right choice with the Rift, and don't regret my purchase one bit. I think if I had spent the extra on the Vive, I would be grossly disappointed. I'm more than happy with my experience so far, and I hope there is more to look forward to in due course.If, like me, you've been wasting time debating this purchase, and you can afford it, hit that buy button! I can't recommend it enough!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 31, 2018
review_title: Epic experience from the modern VR pioneer!

one_reviews_text: At £399 this is such an absolute bargain. After a few days I feel completely relaxed using my Rift and can't stop telling everyone how immersive the experiences are. Robo Recall is just so much fun. If you have been sitting on the fence about buying one.....Get one now!!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 15, 2017

one_reviews_text: It is difficult to explain how great this is if you have never tried it.  The level of immersion is amazing and using the touch controllers really adds to the experience.  If you are thinking of buying a vr system then buy it. Even my hard to impress 14 year old thinks it's 'awesome' and has invited his friends over to show of 'his' vr system.I waited to buy this and wish I hadn't and just got it ages ago. The games are pretty good and there is a good amount of free apps to use. Eve Valkyrie is awesome but don't do a high speed loop the loop when standing up!!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 9, 2017

one_reviews_text: This is my second time trying VR, first time I sold my Oculus as I just didn't have the time to use it, this time around I have a little more time, so glad I gave it another go, that ASW really makes a huge difference, not only does it lower the minimum specs but also allows you to run with higher settings if you have the recommended spec or above, I am using much higher settings in Elite Dangerous than I was last year with no perceptible hit in frame rate, I know there must be a drop in actual frame rate but ASW does such a superb job of hiding it, outstanding.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 6, 2017
review_title: so glad I gave it another go

one_reviews_text: I am a newbie to Virtual Reality technology as I write this review.  So you can understand when I say, oh my goodness!  This product is amazing!  I am a big fan of the Elite Dangerous (Horizons) game and play it quite constantly.  I do get motion sickness on some games such as Project Cars, which is freaky as I am sitting down not moving.  Within one day I found the sound stopped working in the left ear of the headphones.  However the screwdriver that comes in the pack fixed this in a couple of minutes, and I have already bought the in-ear headphones as I prefer them.  I love the product and well worth the price I think.  Thank you Oculus.

one_reviews_text: best thing ever seen
review_date: Reviewed in France on June 13, 2018

one_reviews_text: It's impossible to go back to a flat screen for sim racing now.  Once you've blasted an Evo around Wales in Dirt Rally over undulating hills there is simply no going back.  I highly recommend you get your VR legs prior to trying Dirt Rally because the experience can be intense.Project Cars 2, Assetto Corsa, Robo Recall, Arizona Sunshine are all stellar and well worth playing.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 26, 2017

one_reviews_text: Purchased during the 'summer special'. I now understand why people use words like 'awesome'. Videos such as 'The Blue'  certainly demonstrate its capability (you feel immersed as though you are there) and games that were designed for the Rift like Elite Dangerous are great. The only downsides I have found are the 'screen door' effect (you are looking at a high res screen but as it encompasses your whole field of view the pixels are noticeable); the lack of available software (hopefully in time more may become available); and of course the fact that you can no longer see your mouse/keyboard when gameplaying (to a large extent I overcome this by a mixture of voice commands and HOTAS controls). I do usually wear glasses but found the headset was OK without them; frankly I think it would be very difficult and cumbersome to wear them within the headset (but I did find a third party offering lenses that clip inside the Rift). I found the Rift straightforwards to set up, the headset adequate and overall the experience impressive. Of course it would be nicer to be free of the cables and to have a higher resolution but probably some way off for those!
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 2, 2017
review_title: It is a whole new world!

one_reviews_text: I am not a gamer, more of an outdoors kind of person, I like to travel, I actively play sports 5 days per week. I bought this out of curiosity and, of course, after having read all these raving reviews. Conclusion, add all the reviews up, they are all true, I am not able to add anything else to praise this thing even more. Unique experience, unlike any other I've ever had gaming or otherwise. The same goes for my wife, my 8 year old daughter (she can play without wearing her glasses) and 6 year old son. Children need the straps adjusted properly and, depending on their age, shouldn't be left with the headset on for a long time (no more than 30 minutes before you really check if they are ok) as, for them, the headset feels heavy. I have the 360 degree setup of the 2 sensors, it works well unless you get some into some strange position while playing Robo Recall. For this game alone, I have already ordered a 3rd sensor. I haven't played much, not as much as I want, unfortunately I don't have time for that. Even so, I would buy it again without a second thought. It is an experience worth having in your life... just like having _ex ;)2-months update: The experience keeps getting better and better! The 3rd sensor setup eliminated any problems that used to occur with the 2-sensor setup. It is not an easy task though and any movement of the sensors changes the playable area border. There are good online guides on the optimal setup worth looking up.Some beginner tips.Tip 1: For the sweaty forehead, you can wear a headband. Tip 2: For not tripping over the cable, fix it on your waist line, behind you. Any simple clip works.Tip 3: If you have the sensors on their original base (eg sitting on your desk), you could buy non-slip/sticky pads to keep them in place from minor, accidental movements. Tip 4: Many more games playable on the Rift are available on Steam. The playable area on Steam is a bit different, you might get 2 "borders". In that case, turn off the Rift ones from the Rift's settings. Tip 5: Spend time experimenting with the straps, the tilt, the between eyes distance, the position the headset rests on your head. It can eliminate both blurring and discomfort. Tip 6: Clear your schedule, make time or you are going to lose your sleep :)2.5 years update: Besides family, most of our friends with their children have tried the headset. We call it an "Oculus visit" :) The only problem hardware wise has been a loose screw on the headphone that caused intermittent sound cuts. I have already ordered the Quest but I am planning on keeping the Rift as well so that 2 persons can play together in the house. Favorite/most played games: Beat saber, thrill of the fight, eleven table tennis vr, google earth vr, darth vader immortal and toy box (kids' favourite).
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 27, 2017

one_reviews_text: Génial. une nouvelle façon de jouer.
review_date: Reviewed in France on October 1, 2018

one_reviews_text: Ich hatte bereits das vergnügen mehrere VR Systeme ausprobieren zu können.Mein Fazit zu dieser und anderen Brillen ist wie Folgt:1. Oculus Rift2. Htc Vive3. Rest...Bevor sich einige Fragen warum ich nicht die Vive an erster Stelle gewählt habe ist erklärbar damit dass nach meiner Sicht für den Konsumer kein besseres Headset zur Zeit auf dem Markt verfügbar ist.Die Oculus Rift hat den Komfort und die Super optimierten Spiele welche für so viel Immersion beitragen dass keine der anderen Headset ihr das Wasser im Consumer Bereich reichen können.Was man aber bedenken sollte wenn man sich eine Rift anschafft sind die Mehrkosten welche noch für einen 3. Sensor und die entsprechenden aktiven usb und hdmi kabel anfallen. Erst dies macht die Rift in meinen Augen optimal genießbar (natürlich mit entsprechendem Platzangebot).Um noch auf die Bedienbarkeit zu sprechen zu kommen. Ich habe grosse Hände womit mir eigentlich die Controller der VIVE besser gefallen müssten, jedoch aufgrund des groben handlings niemals so immersiv sind wie diejenigen der Rift welche sich perfekt in die Hand einschmiegen und diese nicht in ihrer Fähigkeiten einschränkt.Seid Euch bewusst, dass nach den ersten paar längeren Spielsessions mit diesen Controllern das Gefühl für eure normalen Hände abhanden kommt. Das ist eine Lustige Erfahrung die man auf jeden Fall gemacht haben muss.Den realen Preis für mein Setup nach kauf des Zubehörs (ohne Berücksichtigung des entsprechenden PCs) beläuft sich eher gegen die 580€ sofern man die Brille im Weinachtssale für 400€ gekauft hat.Ich Bereue meine Investition jedoch keinesfalls und würde sie Jedem Spieleinteressierten weiterempfehlen der Wert auf Bedienbarkeit und Komfort als auch auf optimierte Erfahrungen legt.
review_date: Reviewed in Germany on April 27, 2018

one_reviews_text: When a friend posted online that he had bought one of those, I was surprised - I thought these were expensive? Didn't they require a high-end PC? After doing some research, including using Oculus's own compatibility check tool on their website, I found my 5-year old PC was plenty capable of handling VR (though I did upgrade the video card a couple of years ago to an NVIDIA GTX 1070).I'll just get this out of the way: it's hard to describe what it's like to use one of these. I've used other VR stuff, like Google Cardboard, and this is something completely different. This can trigger things like motion sickness and fear of heights. I've nearly leaned on VR surfaces for balance. Some games place you on top of mountains, which can just be overwhelming. Not everything looks 100% real, but most of it is "good enough" to trick my brain.There are a lot of free games and demos, as well as high-quality paid apps, so there's no shortage of software available. It even comes with a few games, though Robo Recall is definitely the standout title (First Contact is also awesome!). Most of what's available on Steam is compatible, too. I'm having a lot of fun with the Oculus Rift, and I'm really glad I bought this.Other things I should mention:- Although the price was half of what I thought it'd be, it was still significant - from the packaging, it seems like they're trying to pitch this as a game console, which makes sense to me.- The setup process was difficult, and I've had to go through it a few times as I've adjusted the sensors. Installing the drivers was non-obvious, and I ended up searching online for a solution - which involved digging through the application directories and running .exe files directly from Windows Explorer. There's a lot of room for improvement here.- The lenses inside of the headset get dirty easily - my hair sometimes drags on the lenses when removing the headset. It doesn't help that the setup process has you alternate between using a mouse/keyboard on the computer screen, and putting on the headset and using the controllers. I've tried using the included cleaning cloth, but it hasn't really helped.- The controllers use AA batteries, which are included. After about 3 weeks, they died - despite not receiving a lot of usage within the past two weeks (due to travel and a work project demanding my time). I might switch to rechargeable batteries.- The battery doors on the controllers are held in by magnets, which was a really neat touch! However, they could use a an arrow (or something) to indicate how to remove the batteries. I had to search online for the exact place you need to press to remove the battery door.- I know it's not designed to be usable while wearing glasses, but it's tough to use while wearing glasses. My girlfriend is nearly blind without hers, so she hasn't been able to play very much.Additional things you should consider buying to accompany the Oculus Rift:- A third Oculus Sensor. I bought mine as a bundle on Amazon, which really helped.- HDMI and USB extension cables for the headset. Otherwise, you risk damaging your computer and/or the headset if you stray too far from your PC.- Does your video card have two HDMI ports? This wasn't obvious to me before purchasing the headset, but some games won't function properly unless your headset and your monitor are plugged into the same video card (using your motherboard's onboard video card in conjunction won't work). Since my NVIDIA GTX 1070 only had one HDMI port, which I had to use for the headset, I bought a DisplayPort to HDMI cable to connect my TV to the video card as well. It's not possible to know which games require this setup until you actually try to launch them, so I'd recommend looking into this before buying an Oculus Rift for yourself.Overall, totally worth it. This feels like the future!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2018
review_title: I love my Oculus Rift! Here's a bunch of stuff I wish I knew when I bought mine.

one_reviews_text: Goaded on by the £399.00 offer price and after years of waiting to dip my toe into the solitary world of Virtual Reality! I took the plunge last month! The experience was truly breath taking after building a super rig to use the Oculus touch bundle. Being freaked out by heights and being thrust on top of a tumbling crane about 400 feet up off the ground and being completely paralysed with fear at the graphics. I had to laugh afterwards realising I was just stood on my living room carpet, but the visuals and the sound take you too that place of danger, and as much as your head knows you are safe. The stunning re-creations of some locations will simply not let your eyes or brain get away from that primal fear of heights or danger. (There is a whole other tale about being jettisoned into outer space after tumbling out of the relative safety of a space station, but that's another story!) So worth the money? Absolutely! If you have even a modicum of interest in VR and have a fairly decent system to handle the graphics, then go for it!Still a lot of trash on the games front, but this is new tech and you can slowly see some quality gaming rising to the surface. It is the future without a doubt and One hell of an experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 23, 2017
review_title: The future has arrived and we are the pioneers of VR.

one_reviews_text: The oculus rift came very well packed but the tape they use leaves a sticky glue on the cloth part of the headset.The oculus rift takes you to another world and does it well but unfortunately the god rays on some headsets are worse than others from what I have read and this was the case with mine ,it was terrible and it just spoils the experience .I also had problems with head tracking and the headset just freezing up.After 6 hours of trying different things to resolve the freezing I gave up.I probably would have returned it due to the god rays alone.I had no such problems with the controllers and they where some of the best I have ever used.It’s a pity even though the resolution and lenses are not there yet this really is an immersive and fun experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 23, 2017

one_reviews_text: Bought to play games and also develop VR applications. Much prefer this to the Vive for desktop applications. The Vive tended to hurt my neck after 30 minutes of on and off use but the Oculus has never been uncomfortable to wear. Sensors are accurate and versatile. I may buy an additional sensor to put behind the play area to stop my hands not being picked up if I block them with my body. Although the Vive sensors are much easier to use the Oculus sensors take up far less space and look much more professional
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 14, 2017
review_title: Lots of fun, definitely worth it

one_reviews_text: Been wanting this for a while, but it was just out of my price range to justify it. Read somewhere that the price had been dropped, so I smashed the buy button. Delivered next day by UPS  at 9am.Box it comes in is fantastic, nothing rattles around, and everything down to the last wire is secured. I wish everything came boxed like this.Got home and wired it all up, took me about an hour to get it sorted correctly. I had a few problems with being too close to the sensors, so gradually pushing them further back on my desk did the trick. The setup process is very good I found, with the Guardian system a must, unless  you want to punch various objects around you.. Like I totally didn't do..Once I was ready to rock n roll with VR, I played Robo Recall, this was my first time in VR game,  so as predicted I was worse than rubbish, but I found the tutorials easy to follow. They must know people apeiple would have been useless at the start.. So after 20 minutes and some swearing it started to come together.The Touch controllers are amazing, though clumsy at first. After you've had them in your hands and interact with them, it's like using any other controller. (I would recommend using the straps on them around your wrist, just in case you find yourself getting caught in the moment)Next thing to do was download Virtual Desktop from Steam, fired up some 360 videos and got lost in VR. Giggity.Overall I think I haven't really touched the surface with what VR can do (that and just sat there catching flys looking around at everything), I think VR is a glimpse into the future of gaming.Would definitely recommend Oculus Rift.
review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 20, 2017

one_reviews_text: Une très bonne surprise avec l'oculus rift!Avoir cet équipement au quotidien est assez extraordinaire.Aujourd'hui j'ai du mal à jouer sur un "écran plat".J'ai testé tous les jeux gratuits livrés avec le produit et je vous conseille vivement Robot Recall. Il se passe très vite, mais reste l'exemple de l'interactivité et l'immersion possibles quand les développeurs de jeux se penchent serieusement sur un jeu VR.Il n'y a pas que les mini jeux, en effet, après 25 heures passées dans Fallout VR je ne me séparerais de l'oculus pour rien au monde. C'est une expérience très immérsive.Globalement le casque est confortable et facile à ajuster sur la tête grâce à 3 bandelettes scratch pas trop mal foutues. Les contrôleurs de l'oculus qui au départ de par leur look ont instauré la méfiance sont en fait des éléments très bien pensés, qui permettent d'émuler au mieux une main virtuelle.Le tracking de la tête est parfait, il n'y a pas la moindre latence et les couleurs des écrans du casque sont vives et assez contrastées.Quelques bémols qui coûtent à ce produit une étoile :- La résolution (HD dans chaque oeuil), qui reste insuffisante vu que votre champ de vision est néttement supérieur et ça fait pas assez de pixels pour la surface qu'occupe l'image sur votre rétine. Résultat : ne vous attendez pas à une image hyper nette. Les textes restent lisibles cependant.- On a encore la sensation de porter un masque de plongée, car même si l'oculus essaye de remplir votre champ de vision au mieux, vous voyez entre le cadre noir du casque autour de l'image.- Les mini-jeux tels que Robot Recall sont conçus pour être peu gourmands, les AAA tels que Fallout le sont beaucoup plus et votre PC devra se donner pas mal de peine pour afficher 2xHD à 90 FPS (car il faut 90FPS!). J'ai une AMD Fury nitro comme CG (un peu en dessous de la 1070 de chez NVIDIA), et avec beaucoup de peine et configuration j'arrive à jouer en qualité maximale (avec une résolution supérieure à celle des écrans oculus pour améliorer la netteté de l'image). Cependant il y a des utilisateurs qui ne sont pas satisfaits de leur expérience malgré une 1080 ou 1080ti donc pensez à prendre du temps pour la configuration.- Le cable traine dans les pattes et c'est problématique au début (ensuite on apprend).
